member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.BaseGridNetwork
member.summary: Base class for grid networks.

member.summary: The grid node value of an unreachable grid coordinate.

member.summary: The bit flag which marks a safezone node.

member.summary: The bit mask for the cost of a node.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.BaseGridNetwork._grid
member.summary: The two-dimensional grid. For each coordinate it contains the cost of traveling to it from a neighbor coordinate. The value of 0 means, that the coordinate is unreachable.

member.summary: A flag, if safezone nodes should be included in the network.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: If set to true, diagonal traveling is allowed.

member.remarks: Not sure, if the implementation should really filter out nodes based on their status and cost.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.BaseGridNetwork.IsWithinBounds(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Determines whether the coordinates are within bounds of this network.
member.returns: true if the coordinates are within bounds of this network; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.BinaryMinHeap`1
member.summary: A binary min heap which implements . Objects with the lowest index values appear at the top of the heap, and will be retrieved when calling . Please note: This class is not thread safe! Push/Pop should not be executed by two different threads at the same time!.
member.remarks: This class contains some optimizations which do not make the code nicer. However, this data structure is THE bottleneck of the pathfinding algorithm, so optimization is worth it.
member.typeparam: The type which should be contained in the heap.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.BinaryMinHeap`1._i
member.summary: Reused variable to reduce stack allocations.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.BinaryMinHeap`1._parentIndex
member.summary: Reused variable to reduce stack allocations.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.BinaryMinHeap`1._left
member.summary: Reused variable to reduce stack allocations.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.BinaryMinHeap`1._right
member.summary: Reused variable to reduce stack allocations.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Get the smallest object without removing it.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Describes a heuristic which detemines a heuristic distance from the current location to the target location. As better the heuristic as faster an optimal path can be found.

member.summary: Gets or sets the heuristic estimate multiply value.

member.summary: Calculates the heuristic distance from the location to the target.
member.returns: The heuristic distance from the location to the target.

member.summary: Gets the index value of the item.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.IndexedLinkedList`1
member.summary: An indexed linked list which implements . Objects with the lowest index values appears at the first place of the list, and will be retrieved when calling .
member.remarks: This list is a bit slower (~ 3x) at the operation, but a lot faster (10x) at the operation than the .
member.typeparam: The type which should be contained in the heap.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.IndexedLinkedList`1._index
member.summary: The index helps to find a better starting point to insert new nodes.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A comparer for the type which should be conained in the heap. It is used to determine the correct position in the heap.
The indexer, which returns an index value which is used as key.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.INetwork
member.summary: Interface of a network which can be used by the .

member.summary: Gets the node at the specified position.
member.returns: The node at the specified position, or null if there is no node at this position.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.INetwork.GetPossibleNextNodes(MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.Node)
member.summary: Gets the nodes which can be reached by the specified node.
member.returns: The nodes which can be reached by the specified node.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.INetwork.Prepare(MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.Point,MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.Point,System.Byte[0:,0:],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Prepares the network for the next path finding. Resets the status of all nodes of the network. Needed to be called before any new path is being searched.
member.param: The two-dimensional grid. For each coordinate it contains the cost of traveling to it from a neighbor coordinate. The value of 0 means, that the coordinate is unreachable, . If the highest bit of a value is set, it means it's a coordinate of a safezone.
If set to true, safezone nodes should be included in the search.
member.returns: If the preparations were successful and the pathfinding can proceed.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.IPathFinder
member.summary: Interface for a path finder.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.IPathFinder.FindPath(MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.Point,MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.Point,System.Byte[0:,0:],System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Finds the path between two points.
member.param: The two-dimensional grid of the terrain. For each coordinate it contains the cost of traveling to it from a neighbor coordinate. The value of 0 means, that the coordinate is unreachable, . If the highest bit of a value is set, it means it's a coordinate of a safezone.
If set to true, safezone nodes should be included in the search.
The optional cancellation token to cancel the operation.
member.returns: The path between start and end, including , but excluding .

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.IPriorityQueue`1
member.summary: Interface for a priority queue.
member.typeparam: Type which should be contained in the queue.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.IPriorityQueue`1.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements in the queue.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.IPriorityQueue`1.Push(`0)
member.summary: Pushes the specified item into the queue, and puts them at the right place, based on it's priority.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.IPriorityQueue`1.Pop
member.summary: Retrieves the instance with the highest priority, and removes it from the queue.
member.returns: The instance with the highest priority.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.IPriorityQueue`1.Peek
member.summary: Retrieves the instance with the highest priority, without removing it from the queue.
member.returns: The instance with the highest priority.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.IPriorityQueue`1.Clear
member.summary: Clears this instance.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Pathfinding.NodeIndexer
member.summary: An indexer for a , which can be used to calculate the index on the binary heap. The index is the predicted total cost to reach the node, divided by 10. So every 10 values, there is one index entry in the .

member.summary: A heuristic which does not calculate a heuristic distance.
member.remarks: Using this equals the Dijkstra algorithm.

member.summary: An implementation of the pathfinder which finds paths inside a two-dimensional grid. Please note, that this path finder is not thread safe, so only one search is allowed at the same time on one instance.

member.summary: Serializes the path infos into a more compact format. This format uses just 1 byte for end and 1 byte for next step. It can only be used for maximumRange lower than 8, because of the space limitation.
